page.title: 03ATOMIC ENERGY ESTABLISHMENT
page.content: The A.E.E.was set up by the United Kingdom Establishment in the 1950s.to undertake research into the physics of various types of reactors which could generate electricity from nuclear power.The largest reactor is still generating electricity un 1985,but the work has now diversified into the safety studies of reactors;nuclear waste transport;the chemistry of storing nuclear wastes and many other non_nuclear projects including optimising recovery of oil from the North Sea. There is an apprenticeship scheme which takes on about 20 young people a year.The site employs about 1800 people.There are many facilities for the staff including tennis courts, football and volley ball pitches,and a Gymnasium.A Bank visits the site on three days a week for use of the staff
